lines.content: Meet **_Gojo_**, the ultimate task manager inspired by the strongest sorcerer himself! Whether you're organizing deadlines, scheduling events, or keeping track of to-dos, Gojo ensures your productivity stays as sharp as his Infinity.

Gojo Chatbot makes task management effortless by allowing you to add different types of tasks to your list. Whether itâ€™s a simple to-do, a deadline, or an event, Gojo keeps everything organized so you can focus on what truly matters.
The deadline task takes in a task description, as well as when is the task due by.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
The todo task takes in the description of the task.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
The events task takes in a task description, as well as the time duration of the given event.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
This command allows the user to Mark a task that is done.
This command allows the user to unmark the task, if it is already marked as done.
Okay, I've marked this as not done yet. Guess even perfection takes a little time, huh?
Lists out all the current tasks in the list.
Alright, here's the lineup of tasks on your list! Let's breeze through them.
Ah, I see what you did there! Was that a sneaky Gojo-style move to make the task disappear?
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Struggling to find a specific task in your list? The Find feature lets you quickly search for tasks using keywords. Gojo will locate and display all matching tasks with the specified keywords!
Helps the user locate tasks with their specified keywords.
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* This serves as a base class for all specific command implementations.
* Concrete subclasses must provide their own implementation of this method.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute() throws IOException;
* Represents a command to create a new Deadline task and add it to the TaskManager.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* Executes the command by adding a Deadline task to the TaskManager.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the TaskManager.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task description or index.
* @param description The description or index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the command by deleting the specified task from the TaskManager.
* Represents a command to add an event task to the TaskManager.
* Constructs an EventCommand with the specified event description.
* @param description The details of the event task, including its description, start, and end times.
* Executes the command by adding an event task to the TaskManager.
* Represents a command to terminate the program.
* This command prints a farewell message and saves the current task list to a file.
* Executes the exit command by displaying a farewell message
* and saving the current task list to the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while saving the tasks.
* Represents a command to find tasks that match a given keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified search keyword.
* @param description The keyword used to search for matching tasks.
* Executes the command by searching for tasks that contain the given keyword.
* Represents a command to list all tasks stored in the task manager.
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks currently in the task manager.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done in the task manager.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description The description of the task to be marked as completed.
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task in the task manager.
* Represents a command to add a Todo task to the task manager.
* Constructs a TodoCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description The description of the Todo task to be added.
* Executes the command by adding the Todo task to the task manager.
* Represents a command that is unrecognized by the system.
* Executes by printing an error message to notify the user.
* Executes the command by displaying an unknown command message.
* Represents a command to unmark a task.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description The description of the task to be unmarked.
* Executes the command by unmarking the specified task.

* Parses user commands and extracts relevant task information.

* Extracts the task index from the user input command to mark a task.
* @return The zero-based index of the task in the task list.
* @throws IllegalCommandException If the command format is invalid.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the task number is out of range.
* @throws RuntimeException If the task number is not an integer.
* @throws Error If the task is already marked as done.
public static int getNumberToMark(String command) throws IllegalCommandException {
* Extracts the task index from the user input command to unmark a task.
* @return The zero-based index of the task in the task list.
* @throws IllegalCommandException If the command format is invalid.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the task number is out of range.
* @throws RuntimeException If the task number is not an integer.
* @throws Error If the task is already unmarked.
public static int getNumberToUnmark(String command) throws IllegalCommandException {

* @throws IllegalCommandException If the command format is invalid.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the task number is out of range.
* @throws RuntimeException If the task number is not an integer.
public static int getNumberToDelete(String command) throws IllegalCommandException {

* Handles printing messages to the console for user interaction.
* Provides various methods to display task-related updates and chatbot responses.
System.out.println("Hey there! The name's Gojo. The strongest sorcerer you'll ever meet.");
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye! Don't miss me too much, okay?");

* Prints a message indicating that a task has been unmarked.
* @param task The task that has to be unmarked.
System.out.println("Okay, I've marked this as not done yet. Guess even perfection takes a little time huh?:");

* Prints a message indicating that matching tasks have been found.
* Prints an error message when a file loading issue occurs.
System.out.println("Hah, even I can't load this file? Must be cursed!");
* Prints a message for unknown or invalid user commands.
System.out.println("OOPS~! You've officially confused even me! Try again, maybe with actual commands?");
* Manages a list of tasks, providing functionalities to add, remove, and modify tasks.
* Constructs a new TaskManager with an empty task list.
* Retrieves the number of tasks currently in the list.
* @return The size of the task list.
* Prints all tasks currently in the list.
* Retrieves the completion status of a task at a specified index.
* @param index The index of the task.
* @return {@code true} if the task is marked as done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Adds a new Todo task to the list.
System.out.println("Oops~! Looks like you forgot something important. A Todo without a description?");
* Adds a new Deadline task to the list.
* @param command The user input command containing the task description and deadline.
System.out.println("A deadline without a description? Is this a secret mission?");
System.out.println("Hey hey~! Don't forget to set the deadline okay?");
System.out.println("You're almost there! Just tweak that date to yyyy-MM-dd.");
* Adds a new Event task to the list.
* @param command The user input command containing the task description and event timeline.
System.out.println("What is this? An event with no details?");
System.out.println("Is this event happening today, tomorrow, or in the next century?");
* Marks a task as done based on user input.
* @param command The user input command containing the index of the task to be marked.
System.out.println("Uh-oh~! You want me to mark something as done, but... what exactly?");
System.out.println("Huh? That task is not even on the list! Are you seeing things?");
System.out.println("Eh? That task is already done! Trying to get extra credit?");
System.out.println("Uh... am i supposed to use limitless to figure this out?");
* Unmarks a task as based on user input.
* @param command The user input command containing the index of the task to be unmarked.
System.out.println("Woah there~! What am I supposed to unmark here?");
System.out.println("Huh? That task is not even on the list! Are you seeing things?");
System.out.println("Eh? That task isn't even done! Trying to reverse nothing now?");
System.out.println("Huh? You want me to unmark... whatever that is?");
* Deletes a task from the list based on user input.
* @param command The user input command containing the index of the task to be deleted.
System.out.println("Are you trying to delete... nothing? Do you even know what youâ€™re doing?");
System.out.println("Huh? Trying to erase something thatâ€™s not even there? Thatâ€™s cute.");
System.out.println("Okay, whatâ€™s this? Are we speaking in code now?");
* Searches for tasks in the task list that contain the specified keyword.
* @param command The user input containing the keyword to search for.
System.out.println("My bad, I totally spaced out. What was that again?");

* The Deadline task includes a description and a due date, stored as a {@code LocalDate}.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and due date.
* @param description The description of the task.

* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the provided date is in an invalid format.

* @param by The due date string in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* @return A {@code LocalDate} object representing the due date.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the date format is incorrect.

* Returns a formatted string representation of the Deadline task,
* including its type, status, and formatted due date.
* @return A string representing the Deadline task.

public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {

* including its type, status, start time, and end time.

return TASK_TYPE + super.toString() + " (from: " + startTime + " to: " + endTime + ")";
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* This is the base class for the different types of tasks (e.g., Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* the task is not completed initially.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the completion status of the task.
* @return {@code true} if the task is completed, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* "X" represents a completed task, while empty represents an incomplete task.
* @return A string representing the status of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the description in a specific format to be saved in a file.
* @return The string representation of the task in the specified format for saving.
* Returns the type of the task.
* @return The task type as a string.
* Returns a basic string representation of the task, including its completion status.
* Represents a Todo task, which is a simple task without a specific deadline or time frame.
* This class extends the Task class and includes a task type identifier.
* Constructs a Todo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the task type identifier for a Todo task.
* @return A string representing the task type, "[T]".
* Retrieves the description of the Todo task.
* Returns the description of the Todo task in a specific format for saving purposes.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task, including its task type.
* @return A formatted string representing the Todo task.
